Package com.sprites

Class PatrolMovementSprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
        • com.sprites.SimpleSprite
          • com.sprites.PatrolMovementSprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Patrol
    public class PatrolMovementSprite
extends SimpleSprite
    This class is the super class for Patrol and is used to move the patrol around the map. It extends SimpleSprite which gives it a damageHitbox, healthbar and allows you to rotate the patrol

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private void atNextJunction()
      Checks if the patrol has reached the junction at the end of the road it is travelling on - if it has then it calls reachNextJunction().
      Junction getGoal()  
      Junction getPreviousJunction()  
      Road getRoad()  
      int getStart()  
      PatrolMovementSprite getThis()  
      float getX()  
      float getY()  
      private void reachDestination()
      Gives the patrol a new random goal then calls SetGoal to start generating a path from the patrols current position to it's new randomly generated goal
      private void reachNextJunction()
      This controls the patrol's pathQueue and determines whether the patrol has reached it's destination and should be set a new goal or if it can travel onto the next junction in it's pathQueue
      void setGoal​(Junction goal)
      This generates the queue of junctions the patrol will have to travel through to go from it's start position to it's goal position, once it's created a path it calls setSpeedToNextCity
      void setSetRoad​(Road r)  
      private void setSpeedToNextJunction()
      This calculates the speed at which the patrol should move each frame to go from the junction it is at (previousJunction) to the next junction it should go to.
      void setStart​(Junction jStart)  
      void step()
      This is called each frame and is what makes the patrol look like it is moving by updating it's x and y position by an amount set by setSpeedToNextJunction.
      void update​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
      Called each frame, it updates the patrols position
      private void updateRotation()
      This updates the rotation of the patrol so it looks like it is facing the direction it is moving in.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
        Called each frame, it updates the patrols position
        Overrides:
        update in class SimpleSprite
        Parameters:
        batch - The batch to draw onto.

      • setGoal

        public void setGoal​(Junction goal)
        This generates the queue of junctions the patrol will have to travel through to go from it's start position to it's goal position, once it's created a path it calls setSpeedToNextCity
        Parameters:
        goal - node to end up at

      • setSpeedToNextJunction

        private void setSpeedToNextJunction()
        This calculates the speed at which the patrol should move each frame to go from the junction it is at (previousJunction) to the next junction it should go to.

      • updateRotation

        private void updateRotation()
        This updates the rotation of the patrol so it looks like it is facing the direction it is moving in. First calculates this in radians (angle) then converts it into degrees (angleDeg).

      • step

        public void step()
        This is called each frame and is what makes the patrol look like it is moving by updating it's x and y position by an amount set by setSpeedToNextJunction.

      • atNextJunction

        private void atNextJunction()
        Checks if the patrol has reached the junction at the end of the road it is travelling on - if it has then it calls reachNextJunction().

      • reachNextJunction

        private void reachNextJunction()
        This controls the patrol's pathQueue and determines whether the patrol has reached it's destination and should be set a new goal or if it can travel onto the next junction in it's pathQueue

      • reachDestination

        private void reachDestination()
        Gives the patrol a new random goal then calls SetGoal to start generating a path from the patrols current position to it's new randomly generated goal
